page.title: 06LEISURE USE OF THE R. DARENT
page.content: The{River Darent}is widely used by fishermen, birdwatchers and natural- ists. The lakes and the river itself provide fine specimens of pike, chub, carp and perch which bring many anglers during the season. Bird-watchers are attracted by such varied species as finches, wagtails, heron, snipe, kingfishers and Canada geese. Naturalists can find over twenty species of trees including the evergreen oak, the commonest being the hawthorn, and a great variety of waterside plants and flowers, some of which are quite rare, e.g. cuckoo-pint and a woody nightshade. An occasional red fox may be seen in the waterside fields, and hedgehogs and voles along the river. Evidence can be seen of the existence of badgers and moles, and frogs, toads and water insects abound. Families use the river for recreation.
